label: Hello World - part 4: Function Reuse
info: ### Aim To demonstrate how functionality can be reused in Node-RED. ### Explanation Here the [previous flow](https://flowhub.org/f/722b6181086e9abe) is taken and one debug node is removed, being replaced by the original debug node. When the flow is triggered, the same debug output is produced: ![img](https://cdn.openmindmap.org/content/1693043013104_Screen_Shot_2023-08-26_at_11.43.09.png) Although the name of the output node has changed from "output 2" to "output". Alternative forms of function reuse are discussed in the [Node-RED Introduction](https://flowhub.org/f/7f8714fa6e835a2a). There are many ways of reusing functionality, from copy & paste to creating own nodes to be used within Node-RED. What is best for which situation is a matter of learning and experience. ### Related Flows - [Hello World, part 3](https://flowhub.org/f/722b6181086e9abe) - [Node-RED Introduction](https://flowhub.org/f/7f8714fa6e835a2a) which is a step-by-step guide for creating flows.

name: functionality
func:
msg.payload = msg.payload + ", hello Node-RED";

return msg;
